definition:
Let $G$ be a finite group, and let $K$ be a field. A character from $G$
to $K$ is a group homomorphism $\chi\colon G\to K^\times$, where
$K^\times$ is the multiplicative group $K\setminus\{0_K\}$.

[**Example**]{}: The Dirichlet characters are characters from
${\mathbb{Z}}/m{\mathbb{Z}}$ to ${\mathbb{C}}$.
